name: SMART Multiple Choice
description: If the data element is indicative of a multiple choice question (e.g. symptoms), then indicate the type of multiple choice question here.

description[1]: Select one – only one input can be chosen
Select all that apply – more than one input option can be chosen
Each individual answer option should be listed in the Input Options column and be classified with one of the data types listed below

name: SMART Data Type
description: Data Type prescribes the structured format by which the data is represented. In simple terms, the datatype defines the type of data that the concept is intended to collect.

description[1]: Boolean (i.e. True/False)
String (i.e. a sequence of Unicode characters – e.g. name)
Date (e.g. date of birth) – used for when only the date is recorded
Time (e.g. time of delivery) – used for when only the time is recorded
DateTime (e.g. appointment) – used for when you need to record the date and the time
ID (e.g. unique identifier assigned)

Quantity – a number that is associated with a unit of measure outlined in the standard for Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM). Quantities include any number that is associated with a unit, such as "number of past pregnancies”, where "past pregnancies” is the unit of measure (1). If the data type is a "Quantity” there should be an associated subtype listed in the "Quantity subtype” column
Signature (e.g. supervisor’s approval) – an electronic representation of a signature that is either cryptographic or a graphical image that represents a signature or a signature process
Attachment (e.g. image) – additional data content defined in other formats
List-select one (e.g. HIV status) – indicates a list of elements where only one value can be chosen from the list. The elements in the list are of type "List value"
List-select all that apply (e.g. symptoms, danger signs) – indicates a list of elements where more than one value can be chosen from the list. The elements in the list are of type "List value"

List value (e.g. pregnant, HIV-positive, combined pill) – data elements that are values for data elements of type "List - select one" or "List - select all that apply". List value data elements are indented in order to visually mark the fact that they are the list value corresponding to the data element above, whose data type is determined to be "List - select one" or "List - select all that apply" data elements. Double indents are to visually show that they are a sub-set of one of the list values provided above

name: SMART Quantity Sub-type
description: Quantity data types can include any number that is associated with a unit of measure.

description[1]: Integer quantity – a whole number. Examples of values for a data elements with quantity subtype "Integer quantity": "3" for number of pregnancies, "80" for pulse, "120" for systolic blood pressure, "80" for diastolic blood pressure
Decimal quantity – rational numbers that have a decimal representation (e.g. exact weight in kilograms, exact height in centimetres, location coordinates, percentages, temperature)
Duration – duration of time associated with time units (e.g. number of minutes, number of hours, number of days)

name: SMART Optionality
description: Indicates whether or not filling out this data element is required.

description[1]: Conditional on answers from other data elements – C

name: SMART Map Types
description: For data elements that can be mapped, this column should be used to identify the relationship between the original intent of the data element (i.e. "source concept") with the terminology mapping available in existing code systems (i.e. "target concept") (3).
full_name: SMART Mapping to code systems, Relationship

description[1]: the concepts are related to each other, but the exact relationship is not known;
the definitions of the concepts mean the same thing;
the source concept (data element) is narrower in meaning than the target concept (classification/terminology);
the source concept is broader in meaning than the target concept;

name: SMART Concept Class
description: Grouping of similar clinical concepts based on their fundamental nature or purpose within healthcare terminology
